meanings.definition: A person or thing that disintegrates.
meanings.sent1: The old building was a disintegrator, slowly falling apart over the years.
meanings.sent2: The disintegrator of our friendship was a misunderstanding that grew into a big argument.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy was a little disintegrator, chewing up everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: Time can be a disintegrator, breaking down even the strongest of structures.
meanings.sent5: The rust on the metal gate acted as a disintegrator, causing it to weaken and crumble.

meanings.definition: A machine or device that breaks down or destroys something into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The blender in the kitchen is a disintegrator, turning fruits into smoothies.
meanings.sent2: The disintegrator in the factory helps recycle old materials into new products.
meanings.sent3: The little robot vacuum acted like a tiny disintegrator, sucking up all the crumbs on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The storm acted as a powerful disintegrator, tearing down trees and buildings in its path.
meanings.sent5: The shredder at the office is a useful disintegrator, turning papers into tiny pieces for disposal.
